Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; part of rosette in added red and added white above two white bands; below, row of red and white rising tongues above two white bands; below, row of dots and white band; exterior: part of four black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The size and thickness of the sherd show that it comes from a large chalice or heavy chalice.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 93)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1353) (phase 2)
